2035.author: Alexey Akhunov (@AlexeyAkhunov)

2069.title: Recommendation for using YAML ABI in ERCs/EIPs
2069.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic)

2124.title: Fork identifier for chain compatibility checks
2124.author: P√©ter Szil√°gyi <peterke@gmail.com>, Felix Lange <fjl@ethereum.org>

2159.title: Common Prometheus Metrics Names for Clients
2159.author: Adrian Sutton (@ajsutton)

2200.title: Structured Definitions for Net Gas Metering
2200.author: Wei Tang (@sorpaas)

2228.title: Canonicalize the name of network ID 1 and chain ID 1
2228.author: William Entriken (@fulldecent)

2255.title: Wallet Permissions System
2255.description: An interface to restrict access to sensitive methods
2255.author: Dan Finlay (@danfinlay), Erik Marks (@rekmarks), Gavin John (@Pandapip1)

2294.title: Explicit bound to Chain ID size
2294.description: Adds a maximum value to the Chain ID parameter to avoid potential encoding issues that may occur when using large values of the parameter.
2294.author: Zainan Victor Zhou (@xinbenlv), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic)

2315.title: Simple Subroutines for the EVM
2315.description: Two opcodes for efficient, safe, and static subroutines.
2315.author: Greg Colvin (@gcolvin), Martin Holst Swende (@holiman), Brooklyn Zelenka (@expede), John Max Skaller <skaller@internode.on.net>
2315.withdrawal-reason: This proposal has been superseded by the EOF proposals.

2330.title: EXTSLOAD opcode
2330.description: A new EVM opcode to read external contract storage data.
2330.author: Dominic Letz (@dominicletz), Santiago Palladino (@spalladino)

2364.title: eth/64: forkid-extended protocol handshake
2364.description: Introduces validation of the `forkid` when handshaking with peers.
2364.author: P√©ter Szil√°gyi <peterke@gmail.com>, P√©ter Szil√°gyi (@karalabe), Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

2481.title: eth/66 request identifier
2481.description: Introduces a request id for all requests of the eth protocol
2481.author: Christoph Burgdorf (@cburgdorf)

2537.title: Precompile for BLS12-381 curve operations
2537.description: Adds operation on BLS12-381 curve as a precompile in a set necessary to efficiently perform operations such as BLS signature verification.
2537.author: Alex Vlasov (@shamatar), Kelly Olson (@ineffectualproperty), Alex Stokes (@ralexstokes), Antonio Sanso (@asanso)

2565.title: ModExp Gas Cost
2565.author: Kelly Olson (@ineffectualproperty), Sean Gulley (@sean-sn), Simon Peffers (@simonatsn), Justin Drake (@justindrake), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad)

2566.title: Human Readable Parameters for Contract Function Execution
2566.author: Joseph Stockermans (@jstoxrocky)

2584.title: Trie format transition with overlay trees
2584.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet)

2593.title: Escalator fee market change for ETH 1.0 chain
2593.author: Dan Finlay <dan@danfinlay.com>

2666.title: Repricing of precompiles and Keccak256 function
2666.author: Alex Vlasov (@shamatar)

2677.title: Limit size of `initcode`
2677.author: Martin Holst Swende (@holiman), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic)

2718.title: Typed Transaction Envelope
2718.description: Defines a new transaction type that is an envelope for future transaction types.
2718.author: Micah Zoltu (@MicahZoltu)

2733.title: Transaction Package
2733.author: Matt Garnett (@lightclient)
2733.withdrawal-reason: I have decided to pursue EIP-3074 as the preferred solution to transaction packages.

2803.title: Rich Transactions
2803.description: Support 'rich transactions' by allowing transactions from externally owned accounts to execute bytecode directly.
2803.author: Micah Zoltu (@MicahZoltu)

2844.title: Add DID related methods to the JSON-RPC
2844.author: Joel Thorstensson (@oed)

2929.title: Gas cost increases for state access opcodes
2929.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Martin Swende (@holiman)

2935.title: Serve historical block hashes from state
2935.description: Store and serve last 8192 block hashes as storage slots of a system contract to allow for stateless execution
2935.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Tomasz Stanczak (@tkstanczak), Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Gajinder Singh (@g11tech), Tanishq Jasoria (@tanishqjasoria), Ignacio Hagopian (@jsign), Jochem Brouwer (@jochem-brouwer)

2938.title: Account Abstraction
2938.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs), Matt Garnett (@lightclient), Will Villanueva (@villanuevawill), Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn)

2976.title: Typed Transactions over Gossip
2976.description: Adds support for transmission of typed transactions over devp2p.
2976.author: Micah Zoltu (@MicahZoltu)

2982.title: Serenity Phase 0
2982.description: Phase 0 of the release schedule of Serenity, a series of updates to Ethereum a scalable, proof-of-stake consensus
2982.author: Danny Ryan (@djrtwo), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

3026.title: BW6-761 curve operations
3026.author: Youssef El Housni (@yelhousni), Michael Connor (@iAmMichaelConnor), Aurore Guillevic <aurore.guillevic@inria.fr>, hujw77 (@hujw77)

3074.title: AUTH and AUTHCALL opcodes
3074.description: Allow externally owned accounts to delegate control to a contract.
3074.author: Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs), Matt Garnett (@lightclient), Micah Zoltu (@micahzoltu)

3076.title: Slashing Protection Interchange Format
3076.description: A JSON interchange format for proof of stake validators to migrate slashing protection data between clients.
3076.author: Michael Sproul (@michaelsproul), Sacha Saint-Leger (@sachayves), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo)

3085.title: wallet_addEthereumChain RPC Method
3085.description: Adds an RPC method to add EVM-compatible chains
3085.author: Erik Marks (@rekmarks), Pedro Gomes (@pedrouid), Pandapip1 (@Pandapip1)

3155.title: EVM trace specification
3155.author: Martin Holst Swende (@holiman), Marius van der Wijden (@MariusVanDerWijden)

3267.title: Giving Ethereum fees to Future Salaries
3267.author: Victor Porton (@vporton), Victor Porton <porton@narod.ru>

3326.title: Wallet Switch Ethereum Chain RPC Method (`wallet_switchEthereumChain`)
3326.author: Erik Marks (@rekmarks)

3336.title: Paged memory allocation for the EVM
3336.author: Nick Johnson (@arachnid)

3337.title: Frame pointer support for memory load and store operations
3337.author: Nick Johnson (@arachnid)

3368.title: Increase block rewards to 3 ETH, with 2 Year Decay to 1 ETH Scheduled
3368.author: Michael D. Carter (@BitsBeTrippin)

3455.title: SUDO Opcode
3455.description: A new opcode is introduced to allow calling from an arbitrary sender address.
3455.author: William Morriss (@wjmelements), Baptiste Vauthey (@thabaptiser)

3540.title: EOF - EVM Object Format v1
3540.description: EOF is an extensible and versioned container format for EVM bytecode with a once-off validation at deploy time.
3540.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Matt Garnett (@lightclient)

3541.title: Reject new contract code starting with the 0xEF byte
3541.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Alexey Akhunov (@AlexeyAkhunov), Christian Reitwiessner (@chriseth), Martin Swende (@holiman)

3607.title: Reject transactions from senders with deployed code
3607.description: Do not allow transactions for which `tx.sender` has any code deployed.
3607.author: Dankrad Feist (@dankrad), Dmitry Khovratovich (@khovratovich), Marius van der Wijden (@MariusVanDerWijden)

3670.title: EOF - Code Validation
3670.description: Validate EOF bytecode for correctness at the time of deployment.
3670.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast)

3675.title: Upgrade consensus to Proof-of-Stake
3675.description: Specification of the consensus mechanism upgrade on Ethereum Mainnet that introduces Proof-of-Stake
3675.author: Mikhail Kalinin (@mkalinin), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

3690.title: EOF - JUMPDEST Table
3690.description: A special EOF section for storing the list of JUMPDESTs, which simplifies execution time analysis.
3690.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0)

3756.title: Gas Limit Cap
3756.description: Set an in-protocol cap for the gas limit
3756.author: lightclient (@lightclient)

3779.title: Safer Control Flow for the EVM
3779.description: Ensure an essential level of safety for EVM code.
3779.author: Greg Colvin (@gcolvin), Greg Colvin <greg@colvin.org>, Brooklyn Zelenka (@expede)

3788.title: Strict enforcement of chainId
3788.description: Reject transactions that do not explicitly have the same chainId as the node's configuration.
3788.author: Gregory Markou (@GregTheGreek)

3855.title: PUSH0 instruction
3855.description: Introduce a new instruction which pushes the constant value 0 onto the stack
3855.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Hugo De la cruz (@hugo-dc), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast)

3860.title: Limit and meter initcode
3860.description: Limit the maximum size of initcode to 49152 and apply extra gas cost of 2 for every 32-byte chunk of initcode
3860.author: Martin Holst Swende (@holiman), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0)

3978.title: Gas refunds on reverts
3978.description: Reprice reverted SSTORE/CREATE/SELFDESTRUCT/LOGX operations gas via gas refund mechanism
3978.author: Anton Bukov (@k06a), Mikhail Melnik (@ZumZoom)

4200.title: EOF - Static relative jumps
4200.description: RJUMP, RJUMPI and RJUMPV instructions with a signed immediate encoding the jump destination
4200.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast)

4345.title: Difficulty Bomb Delay to June 2022
4345.description: Delays the difficulty bomb to be noticeable in June 2022.
4345.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko), James Hancock (@MadeOfTin), Thomas Jay Rush (@tjayrush)

4396.title: Time-Aware Base Fee Calculation
4396.description: Accounts for block time in the base fee calculation to target a stable throughput by time instead of by block.
4396.author: Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs)

4399.title: Supplant DIFFICULTY opcode with PREVRANDAO
4399.description: Expose beacon chain randomness in the EVM by supplanting DIFFICULTY opcode semantics
4399.author: Mikhail Kalinin (@mkalinin), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo)

4444.title: Bound Historical Data in Execution Clients
4444.description: Prune historical data in clients older than one year
4444.author: George Kadianakis (@asn-d6), lightclient (@lightclient), Alex Stokes (@ralexstokes)

4488.title: Transaction calldata gas cost reduction with total calldata limit
4488.description: Greatly decreases the gas cost of transaction calldata and simultaneously caps total transaction calldata in a block
4488.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs)

4520.title: Multi-byte opcodes prefixed by EB and EC.
4520.description: Reserve `0xEB` and `0xEC` for usage as extended opcode space.
4520.author: Brayton Goodall (@Spore-Druid-Bray), Mihir Faujdar (@uink45)

4736.title: Consensus Layer Withdrawal Protection
4736.description: Additional security for BLSToExecutionChange operation when a consensus layer mnemonic may be compromised, without changing consensus
4736.author: Benjamin Chodroff (@benjaminchodroff), Jim McDonald (@mcdee)

4747.title: Simplify EIP-161
4747.description: Simplify EIP-161 and retroactively deprecate unused aspects of it
4747.author: Peter Davies (@petertdavies)

4750.title: EOF - Functions
4750.description: Individual sections for functions with `CALLF` and `RETF` instructions
4750.author: Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast)

4758.title: Deactivate SELFDESTRUCT
4758.description: Deactivate SELFDESTRUCT by changing it to SENDALL, which does recover all funds to the caller but does not delete any code or storage.
4758.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad)

4760.title: SELFDESTRUCT bomb
4760.description: Deactivate SELFDESTRUCT by changing it to SENDALL and stage this via a stage of exponential gas cost increases.
4760.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad)

4762.title: Statelessness gas cost changes
4762.description: Changes the gas schedule to reflect the costs of creating a witness by requiring clients update their database layout to match.
4762.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad), Ignacio Hagopian (@jsign), Tanishq Jasoria (@tanishqjasoria), Gajinder Singh (@g11tech)

4788.title: Beacon block root in the EVM
4788.description: Expose beacon chain roots in the EVM
4788.author: Alex Stokes (@ralexstokes), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo), Martin Holst Swende (@holiman), lightclient (@lightclient)

4803.title: Limit transaction gas to a maximum of 2^63-1
4803.description: Valid transactions must have a reasonable gas limit
4803.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic)

4844.title: Shard Blob Transactions
4844.description: Shard Blob Transactions scale data-availability of Ethereum in a simple, forwards-compatible manner.
4844.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad), Diederik Loerakker (@protolambda), George Kadianakis (@asn-d6), Matt Garnett (@lightclient), Mofi Taiwo (@Inphi), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs)

4863.title: Beacon chain push withdrawals
4863.description: Support validator withdrawals from the beacon chain to the EVM via a new "push-style" transaction type.
4863.author: Alex Stokes (@ralexstokes), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo)

4881.title: Deposit Contract Snapshot Interface
4881.description: Establishing the format and endpoint for transmitting a snapshot of the deposit Merkle tree
4881.author: Mark Mackey (@ethDreamer)

4895.title: Beacon chain push withdrawals as operations
4895.description: Support validator withdrawals from the beacon chain to the EVM via a new "system-level" operation type.
4895.author: Alex Stokes (@ralexstokes), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo)

4938.title: eth/67 - Removal of GetNodeData
4938.description: Remove GetNodeData and NodeData messages from the wire protocol
4938.author: Marius van der Wijden (@MariusVanDerWijden), Felix Lange <fjl@ethereum.org>, Gary Rong <garyrong@ethereum.org>

5000.title: MULDIV instruction
5000.description: Introduce a new instruction to perform x * y / z in 512-bit precision
5000.author: Harikrishnan Mulackal (@hrkrshnn), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast)

5003.title: Insert Code into EOAs with AUTHUSURP
5003.description: Allow migrating away from ECDSA by deploying code in place of an externally owned account.
5003.author: Dan Finlay (@danfinlay), Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn)

5022.title: Increase price of SSTORE from zero to non-zero to 40k gas
5022.author: Green (@greenlucid)

5027.title: Remove the limit on contract code size
5027.description: Change the limit on contract size from 24576 to infinity
5027.author: Qi Zhou (@qizhou)

5065.title: Instruction for transferring ether
5065.description: Instruction for just transferring ether without transferring the flow of execution
5065.author: Mudit Gupta (@maxsam4)

5069.title: EIP Editor Handbook
5069.description: Organizational structure, decision making process, and other EIP Editor odds and ends.
5069.author: Pooja Ranjan (@poojaranjan), Gavin John (@Pandapip1), Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn), et al.

5081.title: Expirable Trainsaction
5081.description: This EIP adds a new transaction type of that includes expiration with a blocknum
5081.author: Zainan Victor Zhou (@xinbenlv), Nick Johnson (@Arachnid), Konrad Feldmeier <konrad@brainbot.com>

5133.title: Delaying Difficulty Bomb to mid-September 2022
5133.description: Delays the difficulty bomb by a further 700000 blocks, to the middle of September 2022.
5133.author: Tomasz Kajetan Stanczak (@tkstanczak), Eric Marti Haynes (@ericmartihaynes), Josh Klopfenstein (@joshklop), Abhimanyu Nag (@AbhiMan1601)

5283.title: Semaphore for Reentrancy Protection
5283.description: A Precompile-based parallelizable reentrancy protection using the call stack
5283.author: Sergio D. Lerner (@SergioDemianLerner)

5345.title: Silent Signing Extension for JSON-RPC
5345.description: Temporary transaction signing without user interaction
5345.author: Stanley Wu (@fruit37), M√ºcahit B√ºy√ºkyƒ±lmaz (@anndro), Muhammed Emin Aydƒ±n (@muhammedea)

5450.title: EOF - Stack Validation
5450.description: Deploy-time validation of stack usage for EOF functions.
5450.author: Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Danno Ferrin (@shemnon)

5478.title: CREATE2COPY Opcode
5478.description: Reducing the gas cost of contract creation with existing code
5478.author: Qi Zhou (@qizhou)

5593.title: Restrict Ethereum Provider API Injection
5593.description: Wallet guidance for restricting Ethereum Provider API access to secure contexts for improved privacy and security for wallet users.
5593.author: Yan Zhu (@diracdeltas), Brian R. Bondy (@bbondy), Andrea  Brancaleoni (@thypon), Kyle Den Hartog (@kdenhartog)

5656.title: MCOPY - Memory copying instruction
5656.description: An efficient EVM instruction for copying memory areas
5656.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Paul Dworzanski (@poemm), Jared Wasinger (@jwasinger), Casey Detrio (@cdetrio), Pawel Bylica (@chfast), Charles Cooper (@charles-cooper)

5749.title: The 'window.evmproviders' object
5749.description: Add 'window.evmproviders' and suggest the eventual removal of 'window.ethereum'
5749.author: Kosala Hemachandra (@kvhnuke)

5757.title: Process for Approving External Resources
5757.description: Requirements and process for allowing new origins of external resources
5757.author: Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn)

5792.title: Wallet Call API
5792.description: Adds JSON-RPC methods for sending multiple calls from the user's wallet, and checking their status
5792.author: Moody Salem (@moodysalem), Lukas Rosario (@lukasrosario), Wilson Cusack (@wilsoncusack), Dror Tirosh (@drortirosh), Jake Moxey (@jxom), Derek Rein (@arein)

5793.title: eth/68 - Add tx type to tx announcement
5793.description: Adds the transaction type and transaction size to tx announcement messages in the wire protocol
5793.author: Marius van der Wijden (@MariusVanDerWijden)

5806.title: Delegate transaction
5806.description: Adds a new transaction type that allows EOAs to execute arbitrary code through delegation
5806.author: Hadrien Croubois (@Amxx)

5920.title: PAY opcode
5920.description: Introduces a new opcode, PAY, to send ether to an address without calling any of its functions
5920.author: Gavin John (@Pandapip1), Zainan Victor Zhou (@xinbenlv), Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn)

5988.title: Add Poseidon hash function precompile
5988.description: Add a precompiled contract which implements the hash function used in the Poseidon cryptographic hashing algorithm
5988.author: Abdelhamid Bakhta (@abdelhamidbakhta), Eli Ben Sasson (@Elistark), Avihu Levy (@avihu28), David Levit Gurevich (@DavidLevitGurevich)

6046.title: Replace SELFDESTRUCT with DEACTIVATE
6046.description: Change SELFDESTRUCT to not delete storage keys and use a special value in the account nonce to signal deactivation
6046.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic)

6049.title: Deprecate SELFDESTRUCT
6049.description: Deprecate SELFDESTRUCT by discouraging its use and warning about a potential future behavior change.
6049.author: William Entriken (@fulldecent)

6051.title: Private Key Encapsulation
6051.description: defines a specification for encapsulating private keys.
6051.author: Base Labs (@Base-Labs), Weiji Guo (@weiji-cryptonatty)

6110.title: Supply validator deposits on chain
6110.description: Provides validator deposits as a list of deposit operations added to the Execution Layer block
6110.author: Mikhail Kalinin (@mkalinin), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo), Peter Davies (@petertdavies)

6122.title: Forkid checks based on timestamps
6122.description: Modifies the forkid checks to work with timestamps and block numbers
6122.author: Marius van der Wijden (@MariusVanDerWijden)

615.title: Subroutines and Static Jumps for the EVM
615.author: Greg Colvin <greg@colvin.org>, Brooklyn Zelenka (@expede), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Christian Reitwiessner (@chriseth)

6189.title: Alias Contracts
6189.description: Allows the creation of contracts that forward calls to other contracts
6189.author: Gavin John (@Pandapip1)

6190.title: Verkle-compatible SELFDESTRUCT
6190.description: Changes SELFDESTRUCT to only cause a finite number of state changes
6190.author: Gavin John (@Pandapip1)

6206.title: EOF - JUMPF and non-returning functions
6206.description: Introduces instruction for chaining function calls.
6206.author: Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Matt Garnett (@lightclient)

6404.title: SSZ Transactions Root
6404.description: Migration of transactions MPT commitment to SSZ
6404.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

6465.title: SSZ Withdrawals Root
6465.description: Migration of withdrawals MPT commitment to SSZ
6465.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Mikhail Kalinin (@mkalinin)

6466.title: SSZ Receipts Root
6466.description: Migration of receipts MPT commitment to SSZ
6466.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

6475.title: SSZ Optional
6475.description: New SSZ type to represent optional values
6475.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Zahary Karadjov (@zah)

649.title: Metropolis Difficulty Bomb Delay and Block Reward Reduction
649.author: Afri Schoedon (@5chdn), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

6493.title: SSZ Transaction Signature Scheme
6493.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Matt Garnett (@lightclient), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

658.title: Embedding transaction status code in receipts
658.author: Nick Johnson <nick@ethereum.org>

663.title: SWAPN, DUPN and EXCHANGE instructions
663.description: Introduce additional instructions for manipulating the stack which allow accessing the stack at higher depths
663.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Charles Cooper (@charles-cooper), Danno Ferrin (@shemnon)

665.title: Add precompiled contract for Ed25519 signature verification
665.author: Tobias Oberstein <tobias.oberstein@crossbario.com>

6690.title: EVM Modular Arithmetic Extensions (EVMMAX)
6690.description: Create modular addition, subtraction, and multiplication opcodes.
6690.author: Jared Wasinger (@jwasinger), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic)

6780.title: SELFDESTRUCT only in same transaction
6780.description: SELFDESTRUCT will recover all funds to the target but not delete the account, except when called in the same transaction as creation
6780.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad)

6789.title: Rename gas to mana
6789.description: This EIP suggests renaming gas to mana, as proposed by Vitalik Buterin in 2015
6789.author: Pascal Caversaccio (@pcaversaccio)

6800.title: Ethereum state using a unified verkle tree
6800.description: This introduces a new Verkle state tree alongside the existing MPT.
6800.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad), Kevaundray Wedderburn (@kevaundray), Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Piper Merriam (@pipermerriam), Gottfried Herold (@GottfriedHerold), Ignacio Hagopian (@jsign), Tanishq Jasoria (@tanishqjasoria), Gajinder Singh (@g11tech), Danno Ferrin (@shemnon)

6810.title: Ex Post Facto Cascading Revert
6810.description: Allow transactions to be reversed after confirmation
6810.author: William Morriss (@wjmelements)

6811.title: To The Moon‚Äî10 Minute Blocks
6811.description: Increases the block time to facilitate finality over cosmic distances
6811.author: Pandapip1 (@Pandapip1)

684.title: Revert creation in case of collision
684.description: Revert contract creation if address already has code
684.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Renan Rodrigues de Souza (@RenanSouza2)

6873.title: Preimage retention
6873.description: Execution clients must retain the preimages of addresses and slots accessed between the fork preceding the verge, and the verge itself.
6873.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet)

6888.title: Math checking in EVM
6888.description: Check for math underflows overflows and division by zero at EVM level
6888.author: Renan Rodrigues de Souza (@RenanSouza2)

689.title: Address Collision of Contract Address Causes Exceptional Halt
689.author: Yoichi Hirai <i@yoichihirai.com>

6913.title: SETCODE instruction
6913.description: new instruction to replace code in-place
6913.author: William Morriss (@wjmelements)

6914.title: Reuse Withdrawn Validator Indices
6914.description: Reuse fully withdrawn and safe to reuse validator indices for new beacon chain deposits.
6914.author: Lion (@dapplion), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo)

6916.title: Automatically Reset Testnet
6916.description: A testnet network that periodically rolls back to genesis
6916.author: M√°rio Havel (@taxmeifyoucan), pk910 (@pk910), R√©my Roy (@remyroy), Holly Atkinson (@atkinsonholly), Tereza Burianova (@T-ess)

695.title: Create `eth_chainId` method for JSON-RPC
695.author: Isaac Ardis <isaac.ardis@gmail.com>, Wei Tang (@sorpaas), Fan Torchz (@tcz001), Erik Marks (@rekmarks)

6953.title: Network Upgrade Activation Triggers
6953.description: Exhaustive list of network upgrade activation mechanisms
6953.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

6963.title: Multi Injected Provider Discovery
6963.description: Using window events to announce injected Wallet Providers
6963.author: Pedro Gomes (@pedrouid), Kosala Hemachandra (@kvhnuke), Richard Moore (@ricmoo), Gregory Markou (@GregTheGreek), Kyle Den Hartog (@kdenhartog), Glitch (@glitch-txs), Jake Moxey (@jxom), Pierre Bertet (@bpierre), Darryl Yeo (@darrylyeo), Yaroslav Sergievsky (@everdimension)

6968.title: Contract Secured Revenue on an EVM based L2
6968.description: Contract Secured Revenue on an EVM based L2
6968.author: Zak Cole <zak@numbergroup.xyz>, Zak Cole (@zscole), Kevin Owocki <kevin@supermodular.xyz>, lightclient (@lightclient)

6988.title: Elected block proposer has not been slashed
6988.description: Prevents a slashed validator from being elected as a block proposer
6988.author: Mikhail Kalinin (@mkalinin)

7002.title: Execution layer triggerable withdrawals
7002.description: Allow validators to trigger exits and partial withdrawals via their execution layer (0x01) withdrawal credentials
7002.author: Danny Ryan (@djrtwo), Mikhail Kalinin (@mkalinin), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs), Hsiao-Wei Wang (@hwwhww), lightclient (@lightclient)

7039.title: Scheme-Handler Discovery Option for Wallets
7039.description: Using custom protocol handlers to initiate connections between web pages and wallets.
7039.author: Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn)

7044.title: Perpetually Valid Signed Voluntary Exits
7044.description: Lock voluntary exit signature domain on capella for perpetual validity
7044.author: Lion (@dapplion)

7045.title: Increase max attestation inclusion slot
7045.description: Increases max attestaton inclusion slot to the last slot in `N+1` where `N` is the epoch containing the attestation's slot.
7045.author: Danny Ryan (@djrtwo)

7069.title: Revamped CALL instructions
7069.description: Introduce EXTCALL, EXTDELEGATECALL and EXTSTATICCALL with simplified semantics
7069.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Danno Ferrin (@shemnon), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Charles Cooper (@charles-cooper)

712.title: Typed structured data hashing and signing
712.description: A procedure for hashing and signing of typed structured data as opposed to just bytestrings.
712.author: Remco Bloemen (@Recmo), Leonid Logvinov (@LogvinovLeon), Jacob Evans (@dekz)

7199.title: Linter Scope
7199.description: Relax the policy for updating EIP.
7199.author: Zainan Victor Zhou (@xinbenlv)
7199.withdrawal-reason: Policy is documented in EIP-1 and EIP-5069.

7212.title: Precompile for secp256r1 Curve Support
7212.description: Proposal to add precompiled contract that performs signature verifications in the ‚Äúsecp256r1‚Äù elliptic curve.
7212.author: Ula≈ü Erdoƒüan (@ulerdogan), Doƒüan Alpaslan (@doganalpaslan), DC Posch (@dcposch), Nalin Bhardwaj (@nalinbhardwaj)

7251.title: Increase the MAX_EFFECTIVE_BALANCE
7251.description: Allow validators to have larger effective balances, while maintaining the 32 ETH lower bound.
7251.author: mike (@michaelneuder), Francesco (@fradamt), dapplion (@dapplion), Mikhail (@mkalinin), Aditya (@adiasg), Justin (@justindrake), lightclient (@lightclient)

7266.title: Remove BLAKE2 compression precompile
7266.description: Remove the blake2f (0x09) precompile by changing the precompile behaviour to result in an exceptional abort
7266.author: Pascal Caversaccio (@pcaversaccio)

7329.title: ERC/EIP Repository split
7329.description: Split the ERC specifications out of the EIP repository into a new repository, so that only core protocol EIPs remain
7329.author: Lightclient (@lightclient), Danno Ferrin (@shemnon)

7377.title: Migration Transaction
7377.description: Allow EOAs to send a one-time transaction which deploys code at their account.
7377.author: lightclient (@lightclient), Sam Wilson (@samwilsn), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs)

7378.title: Add time-weighted averaging to the base fee
7378.description: Using geometric weights to average past block sizes into consideration
7378.author: Guy Goren (@guy-goren) <guy.nahsholim@gmail.com>

7441.title: Upgrade block proposer election to Whisk
7441.description: Allow elected block proposers to remain private until block publishing, to prevent DoS attacks
7441.author: George Kadianakis (@asn-d6), Justin Drake (@JustinDrake), dapplion (@dapplion)

747.title: wallet_watchAsset RPC Method
747.description: Adds a new RPC method that allows websites to prompt users to watch an asset
747.author: Dan Finlay (@danfinlay), Esteban Mino (@estebanmino), Gavin John (@Pandapip1)

7480.title: EOF - Data section access instructions
7480.description: Instructions to read data section of EOF container
7480.author: Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast)

7495.title: SSZ StableContainer
7495.description: New SSZ type to represent a flexible container with stable serialization and merkleization
7495.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Cayman (@wemeetagain)

7503.title: Zero-Knowledge Wormholes
7503.description: Enable minting of secretly burnt Ethers as a native privacy solution for Ethereum
7503.author: Keyvan Kambakhsh (@keyvank), Hamid Bateni (@irnb), Amir Kahoori <a.kahoorizadeh@gmail.com>, Nobitex Labs <labs@nobitex.ir>

7514.title: Add Max Epoch Churn Limit
7514.description: Modify the churn limit function to upper bound it to a max value
7514.author: dapplion (@dapplion), Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7516.title: BLOBBASEFEE instruction
7516.description: Instruction that returns the current data-blob base-fee
7516.author: Carl Beekhuizen (@carlbeek)

7519.title: Atomic Storage Operations SCREDIT and SDEBIT
7519.description: Add atomic operations for incrementing and decrementing storage slots
7519.author: Danno Ferrin (@shemnon)

7523.title: Empty accounts deprecation
7523.description: Prohibit empty accounts on post-merge networks
7523.author: Peter Davies (@petertdavies)

7542.title: eth/70 - available-blocks-extended protocol
7542.description: Adds more info in the handshake about available block range and adds message types to request block ranges and the send them
7542.author: Ahmad Bitar (@smartprogrammer93) <smartprogrammer@windowslive.com>

7543.title: EVM arbitrary precision decimal math
7543.description: This EIP adds OPCODEs to allow arbitrary precision decimal float calculation of all elementary functions with precise gas enumeration.
7543.author: 1m1 (@1m1-github)

7545.title: Verkle proof verification precompile
7545.description: Add a precompile to help dapps verify verkle proofs
7545.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Diederik Loerakker (@protolambda)

7547.title: Inclusion lists
7547.description: Add an inclusion list mechanism to allow forced transaction inclusion.
7547.author: mike (@michaelneuder), Vitalik (@vbuterin), Francesco (@fradamt), Terence (@terencechain), potuz (@potuz), Manav (@manav2401)

7549.title: Move committee index outside Attestation
7549.description: Move committee index outside of the signed Attestation message
7549.author: dapplion (@dapplion)

7568.title: Hardfork Meta Backfill - Berlin to Shapella
7568.description: Pointers to specifications used for the network upgrades from Berlin to Shapella.
7568.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7569.title: Hardfork Meta - Dencun
7569.description: EIPs included in the Deneb/Cancun Ethereum network upgrade.
7569.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7577.title: Versioning Scheme for EIPs
7577.description: Use a versioning scheme for EIPs based on changes made to their Specification section.
7577.author: danceratopz (@danceratopz), Ahmad Bitar (@smartprogrammer93)

758.title: Subscriptions and filters for completed transactions
758.author: Jack Peterson <jack@tinybike.net>

7587.title: Reserve Precompile Address Range for RIPs
7587.description: Reserve precompile address range for use by the RIP process
7587.author: Carl Beekhuizen (@carlbeek), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs), Danny Ryan (@djrtwo), Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7591.title: BLS signed transactions
7591.description: Introduces a new transaction type signed with BLS signatures
7591.author: Marius van der Wijden (@MariusVanDerWijden)

7594.title: PeerDAS - Peer Data Availability Sampling
7594.description: Introducing simple DAS utilizing gossip distribution and peer requests
7594.author: Danny Ryan (@djrtwo), Dankrad Feist (@dankrad), Francesco D'Amato (@fradamt), Hsiao-Wei Wang (@hwwhww)

7600.title: Hardfork Meta - Pectra
7600.description: EIPs included in the Prague/Electra Ethereum network upgrade.
7600.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7607.title: Hardfork Meta - Osaka
7607.description: EIPs included in the Osaka Ethereum network upgrade.
7607.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7609.title: Decrease base cost of TLOAD/TSTORE
7609.description: Improve the efficiency of TLOAD/TSTORE by decreasing the base cost and introducing a superlinear pricing model.
7609.author: Charles Cooper (@charles-cooper), James Prestwich (@prestwich), brockelmore (@brockelmore)

7610.title: Revert creation in case of non-empty storage
7610.description: Revert contract creation if address already has the non-empty storage
7610.author: Gary Rong (@rjl493456442), Martin Holst Swende (@holiman)

7612.title: Verkle state transition via an overlay tree
7612.description: Describes the use of an overlay tree to use the verkle tree structure, while leaving the historical state untouched.
7612.author: Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs), Ignacio Hagopian (@jsign), Gottfried Herold (@GottfriedHerold), Jamie Lokier (@jlokier), Tanishq Jasoria (@tanishqjasoria), Parithosh Jayanthi (@parithosh), Gabriel Rocheleau (@gabrocheleau), Karim Taam (@matkt)

7620.title: EOF Contract Creation
7620.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Piotr Dobaczewski (@pdobacz)

7623.title: Increase calldata cost
7623.description: Increase calldata cost to decrease the maximum block size
7623.author: Toni Wahrst√§tter (@nerolation), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

7636.title: Extension of EIP-778 for "client" ENR Entry
7636.description: Add additional ENR entry to specify client information such as name and version number.
7636.author: James Kempton (@JKincorperated)

7639.title: Cease serving history before PoS
7639.description: Execution layer clients will no longer serve block data before Paris over p2p.
7639.author: lightclient (@lightclient)

7642.title: eth/69 - Drop pre-merge fields
7642.description: Drop unnecessary fields after the merge
7642.author: Marius van der Wijden (@MariusVanDerWijden)

7643.title: History accumulator for pre-PoS data
7643.description: Commit to a single root for all block data before the merge.
7643.author: lightclient (@lightclient), kdeme (@kdeme)

7645.title: Alias ORIGIN to SENDER
7645.description: Eliminate ORIGIN tech debt to lay groundwork for account abstraction and close security holes
7645.author: Cyrus Adkisson (@cyrusadkisson), Eirik Ulvers√∏y (@EirikUlversoy)

7650.title: Programmable access lists
7650.description: Add a precompiled contract that add access lists programmatically
7650.author: Qi Zhou (@qizhou), Zhiqiang Xu (@zhiqiangxu)

7657.title: Sync committee slashings
7657.description: Slashing condition for malicious sync committee messages
7657.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status)

7658.title: Light client data backfill
7658.description: Mechanism for beacon nodes for syncing historical light client data
7658.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status)

7664.title: Access-Key opcode
7664.description: The access-key opcode enables contracts to read inputs that are statically declared in access-lists.
7664.author: Diederik Loerakker (@protolambda)
7664.withdrawal-reason: Niche use-case, better implemented with EIP-7702.

7666.title: EVM-ify the identity precompile
7666.description: Remove the identity precompile, and put into place a piece of EVM code that has equivalent functionality
7666.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

7667.title: Raise gas costs of hash functions
7667.description: Raise the gas costs of hash function opcodes and precompiles, to match prover expenses in ZK-EVMs
7667.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

7668.title: Remove bloom filters
7668.description: Remove bloom filters from the execution block
7668.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

7675.title: Retroactively Included EIPs
7675.description: Core EIPs activated independently of an Ethereum hard fork.
7675.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7676.title: EOF - Prepare for Address Space Extension
7676.description: Update EOF opcodes so addresses are not trimmed during execution
7676.author: Danno Ferrin (@shemnon)

7684.title: Return deposits for distinct credentials
7684.description: Automatically withdraw deposits for existing validator records but with distinct execution withdrawal credentials
7684.author: Lion (@dapplion)

7685.title: General purpose execution layer requests
7685.description: A general purpose bus for sharing EL triggered requests with the CL
7685.author: lightclient (@lightclient)

7686.title: Linear EVM memory limits
7686.description: Adjust memory limits and gas limits of sub-calls to create a clear linear bound on how much total memory an EVM execution can consume
7686.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

7688.title: Forward compatible consensus data structures
7688.description: Transition consensus SSZ data structures to StableContainer
7688.author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Cayman (@wemeetagain)

7692.title: EVM Object Format (EOFv1) Meta
7692.description: List of EIPs belonging to the EOFv1 proposal
7692.author: Alex Beregszaszi (@axic), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Piotr Dobaczewski (@pdobacz), Danno Ferrin (@shemnon)

7698.title: EOF - Creation transaction
7698.description: Deploy EOF contracts using creation transactions
7698.author: Piotr Dobaczewski (@pdobacz), Andrei Maiboroda (@gumb0), Pawe≈Ç Bylica (@chfast), Alex Beregszaszi (@axic)

7701.title: Native Account Abstraction with EOF
7701.description: A variant of RIP-7560 transactions relying on EOF Smart Contract Accounts
7701.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Yoav Weiss (@yoavw), Alex Forshtat (@forshtat), Dror Tirosh (@drortirosh), Shahaf Nacson (@shahafn)

7702.title: Set EOA account code
7702.description: Add a new tx type that sets the code for an EOA during execution
7702.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Sam Wilson (@SamWilsn), Ansgar Dietrichs (@adietrichs), Matt Garnett (@lightclient)

7703.title: Increase calldata cost
7703.description: Increase calldata cost to decrease the maximum block size
7703.author: William Morriss (@wjmelements)

7705.title: NONREENTRANT and REENTRANT opcodes
7705.description: Opcodes to mark a contract as nonreentrant
7705.author: Charles Cooper (@charles-cooper)

7706.title: Separate gas type for calldata
7706.description: Create a separate basefee and gaslimit for calldata
7706.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

7707.title: Incentivize Access List Provisioning
7707.description: This EIP proposes updating gas cost parameters for access lists to incentivise their use and improve transaction execution efficiency.
7707.author: Ben Adams (@benaadams), Oleg Iakushkin (@OlegJakushkin)

7708.title: ETH transfers emit a log
7708.description: All ETH transfers emit a log
7708.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Peter Davies (@petertdavies)

7709.title: Read BLOCKHASH from storage and update cost
7709.description: Read the `BLOCKHASH (0x40)` opcode from the EIP-2935 system contract storage and adjust its gas cost to reflect storage access.
7709.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin), Tomasz Stanczak (@tkstanczak), Guillaume Ballet (@gballet), Gajinder Singh (@g11tech), Tanishq Jasoria (@tanishqjasoria), Ignacio Hagopian (@jsign), Jochem Brouwer (@jochem-brouwer), Gabriel Rocheleau (@gabrocheleau)

7713.title: Box type for EIP-712 messages
7713.description: A mechanism for EIP-712 messages to contain parameters of arbitrary type
7713.author: Francisco Giordano (@frangio)

7716.title: Anti-correlation attestation penalties
7716.description: Adjust penalties for missed attestations based on in-slot correlation of missed attestation
7716.author: dapplion (@dapplion), Toni Wahrst√§tter (@nerolation), Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

7723.title: Network Upgrade Inclusion Stages
7723.description: Overview of the various stages Core EIPs go through before their activation in network upgrades.
7723.author: Tim Beiko (@timbeiko)

7727.title: EVM Transaction Bundles
7727.description: Enable meta transactions to order other transactions without revert protections.
7727.author: Lily Johnson (@lilyjjo)

7732.title: Enshrined Proposer-Builder Separation
7732.description: Separates the ethereum block in consensus and execution parts, adds a mechanism for the consensus proposer to choose the execution proposer.
7732.author: Francesco D'Amato <francesco.damato@ethereum.org>, Barnab√© Monnot <barnabe.monnot@ethereum.org>, Michael Neuder <michael.neuder@ethereum.org>, Potuz (@potuz), Terence Tsao <ttsao@offchainlabs.com>

8.title: devp2p Forward Compatibility Requirements for Homestead
8.author: Felix Lange <felix@ethdev.com>

858.title: Reduce block reward and delay difficulty bomb
858.author: Carl Larson <cslarson@gmail.com>

86.title: Abstraction of transaction origin and signature
86.author: Vitalik Buterin (@vbuterin)

867.title: Standardized Ethereum Recovery Proposals
867.author: Dan Phifer <dp@musiconomi.com>, James Levy <james@taptrust.com>, Reuben Youngblom <reuben@taptrust.com>

908.title: Reward clients for a sustainable network
908.author: James Ray (@jamesray1), Micah Zoltu (@MicahZoltu)

969.title: Modifications to ethash to invalidate existing dedicated hardware implementations
969.author: David Stanfill <david@airsquirrels.com>
